thread.title: Video: Pedro’s Goal v Wolves Was Finish To A Lovely Chelsea Team Move
thread.title_full: Video: Pedro’s Goal v Wolves Was Finish To A Lovely Chelsea Team Move

title: Video: Pedro’s Goal v Wolves Was Finish To A Lovely Chelsea Team Move
text:
Video: Pedro’s Goal v Wolves Was Finish To A Lovely Chelsea Team Move Sat Feb 18 2017 21:00:12   21:00:12 GMT+0000 (GMT) James Parrott James Parrott in football 
Pedro's goal against Wolves tonight was a great finish to a lovely team move by Chelsea. 
And it looks like it could be the goal to send the Stamford Bridge outfit into the quarter finals of the FA Cup at the expense of their Molineux opponents. 
Antonio Conte named a strong team for the trip to the English Championship side, with Diego Costa, Eden Hazard and Cesc Fabregas in his starting line-up. 
But it was Pedro, who was lining up as a right wing back, who made the difference when he headed home in the 65th minute. 
The goal came at the end of a lovely team move from Chelsea, with William's deft cross being directed into the back of the net by Pedro: It's taken 65 minutes but @ChelseaFC finally break the deadlock at Molineux. #EmiratesFACup #WOLvCHE https://t.co/Pk8vLToMyx - BT Sport Football (@btsportfootball) February 18, 2017 
You can see more of the move in the build-up to the finish here: 
Diego Costa sealed Chelsea's place with his 16th goal of the season as he slid a low finish past Carl Ikeme: At last Costa scored pic.twitter.com/pnQvqoIJqY - Chelsea Fc:m: (@Chelseafcpoll) February 18, 2017 Sponsored Links
